p: The Cl −/Na ++K + ratio in a test substance can predict the modes of the diuretic mechanism of the CAIs effect [ 38]. If the Cl −/Na ++K + ratio is between 0.8 and 1.00, it excludes the CAI effect, but if below 0.8, it is considered to have strong CAI activity [ 31]. In this study, excluding the AF and CF, both the HME and EAF showed a strong CAI effect. This indicates that these fractions possibly have a different diuretic mode of action.
